intro: Dianthus legionensis, commonly known as the carnation, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers consist of two rows of petals, with the outer row being larger and more showy. Dianthus legionensis is widely cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant colors and long-lasting blooms.
